result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob R Guinand was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow transfer to Washington County.
Concurrent with: Washington County Case.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution of $944.85 to be paid as follows:  $500 payable to Karen F. and $444.85 payable to the insurance company.  Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs ($278) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
No contact with Karen F. (victim listed in the Criminal Complaint) or her residence.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 62 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with the victims listed in the criminal complaint.  Court will allow contact with the defendant's mother ONLY with her permission.

Outstanding restitution ($944.85) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Outstanding court costs ($278) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz and A.D.A. Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jacob R Guinand in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Chris Bailey.    

State presented their recommendations to the court.
Defense presented their recommendations to the court.

Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 4 Years.
Initial Confinement: 2 Years.
Extended Supervision: 2 Years.
62 Days Credit.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victims listed in the criminal complaint, one of the victims is the defenant's mother court will allow contact but only with her permission.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Any outstanding restitution and court costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant to be transferred to D.C.I. - FORTHWITH.
